17.1	Choice	of	Law

This	Agreement	shall	be	interpreted	and	construed	under	the	laws	of	the	State	of	New	York.	In	the	event	of	any	conflict	of	law,	the	laws
of	New	York	shall	prevail,	without	regard	to	the	application	of	such	state’s	conflict	of	law	rules.	If,	however,	any	provision	of	this	Agreement
would	not	be	enforceable	under	the	laws	of	New	York,	and	if	the	Franchised	Business	is	located	outside	of	New	York	and	such	provision
would	be	enforceable	under	the	laws	of	the	state	in	which	the	Franchised	Business	is	located,	then	such	provision	shall	be	interpreted	and
construed	under	the	laws	of	that	other	state.	Nothing	in	this	Section	17.1	is	intended	by	the	parties	to	subject	this	Agreement
to	laws,	rules,	or	regulation
of	any	state	to	which	it	would	not	otherwise	be	subject.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.12 Compliance with Governmental Regulations and Applicable Law

You and your principals agree to comply, and to assist us to the fullest extent possible in our efforts to comply, with Anti-Terrorism Laws (defined below). In connection with that compliance, you and your principals certify, represent, and warrant that none of your property or interests is subject to being blocked under, and that you and your principals otherwise are not in violation of, any of the Anti-Terrorism Laws. “Anti-Terrorism Laws” mean Executive Order 13224 issued by the President of the United States, the USA PATRIOT Act, and all other present and future federal, state, and local laws, ordinances, regulations, policies, lists, and other requirements of any governmental authority addressing or in any way relating to terrorist acts and acts of war. Any violation of the Anti-Terrorism Laws by you or your principals, or any blocking of your or your principals’ assets under the Anti-Terrorism Laws, shall constitute good cause for immediate termination of this Agreement.

17.1	Choice	of	Law

This	Agreement	shall	be	interpreted	and	construed	under	the	laws	of	the	State	of	New	York.	In	the	event	of	any	conflict	of	law,	the	laws
of	Nevada	shall	prevail,	without	regard	to	the	application	of	such	state’s	conflict	of	law	rules.	If,	however,	any	provision	of	this	Agreement
would	not	be	enforceable	under	the	laws	of	Nevada,	and	if	the	Franchised	Business	is	located	outside	of	Nevada	and	such	provision
would	be	enforceable	under	the	laws	of	the	state	in	which	the	Franchised	Business	is	located,	then	such	provision	shall	be	interpreted	and
construed	under	the	laws	of	that	other	state.	Nothing	in	this	Section	17.1	is	intended	by	the	parties	to	subject	this	Agreement
to	laws,	rules,	or	regulation	of	any	state	to	which	it	would	not	otherwise	be	subject.
perturbation.explanation: The applicable law section is modified to introduce contradiction and unclarity. The contract applies to New York law, but the new text mentions that if the franchise is not enforceable, Nevada Law will prevail, and that it does not want to be applicable to any state it should not be in. Additionally, the anti-terrorism clause, which is relevant to compliance and governmental regulations, is moved to the choice of law section.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Choice of Law, Patriot Act

4.6	Unit	Franchise	Agreements	and	Revenue	Reports

You	shall	submit	to	us	copies	of	all	Unit	Franchise	Agreements	executed	with	Unit	Franchisees	within	ten	(10)	days	of	the	date	of	their
execution,	together	with	a	copy	of	all	checks	presented	to	you	at	closing.	You	shall	prepare	and	submit	to	us	a	monthly	report,	not	later	than	the
first	(1	st	)	day	of	each	month,	of	Franchise	Sales	Revenue	generated	by	you	during	the	previous	calendar	month.	Contemporaneously	with	the
submission	of	the	Franchise	Sales	Revenue	report,	you	shall	prepare	and	submit	to	us	a	monthly	report,	in	such	form	and	including	such	detail
as	we	require,	reflecting	royalty	fees	paid	and	owed	to	you	by	your	Unit	Franchisees	for	the	previous	calendar	month.	Any	report	not	actually
received	by	us	when	due	shall	be	deemed	overdue	and	you	shall	pay	us	a	late	charge	as	described	above.

perturbation.explanation: The jury trial waiver, a fundamental right that needs to be presented clearly and conspicuously, is moved to a section on financial reporting, and contradicted with a jury trial clause. Its enforceability is significantly reduced due to its illogical placement, while inserting a section in this same section that grants it introduces uncertainty.

 18.2.3 All expenses, including reasonable attorneys’ fees, which we do not incur in connection with collecting any or all Indebtedness secured thereby or in enforcing or protecting our rights under the Security Interest and this Agreement; and
perturbation.explanation: The attorney's fee clause which is meant to be in the 'Security Interest' section is moved to the 'Training Program', introducing ambiguity about when attorneys' fees will be covered. Additionally, the removal of covering it makes it more difficult to enforce the clause.
